author: axic3354
content: There has been such a proposal from years ago, from the 0x people

author: axic3354
content:
Basically it would be an implementation of ERC20 with having access to all ether, so that instead of needing to wrap ether into something like weth, it could be used as a token. The obvious benefit is the simplicity and potential gas savings for the users.

This may be a precompile (which is entirely implemented using native client code) or a system contract (which would need some primitives exposed). I think the biggest blocker was whether how future proof this is (how long will ERC20s usability last), and the trade off did not seem to be worth it.

author: axic3354
content: Given weth is the top 1 contract in terms of holdings (>6M ether), is this still a pressing issue? Do projects still tend to implement support for both native ether and erc20 at the same time?
